title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Los Angeles, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Not a tough interview. Standard questions. No surprises. Basic and entry level position, so as you would expect. Just not the right fit for me now. Nothing bad or negative to report.
Interview Questions: How have you managed up before?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: Very standard Interview - talked with supervisors of the position. Discussed goals, strengths, experience and how the role works. It took no more than 30 minutes. Everyone there was really nice.
Interview Questions: What is one area of improvement you might need when stepping into this role.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was great and very casual. It was a very relaxed conversation. It lasted around 30 minutes, more or less. We discussed general background and general interests. There were a few others interviewing.
Interview Questions: Where are you originally from?

title: Contractor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: There was poor follow through with no follow up after the interview. Perhaps the group is busy or disinterested. In any case, disappointed that there was no explanation or closure.
Interview Questions: What is your background in this area?

title: Content Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: There was an extensive written questionaire during the application process.  I appreciated this opportunity and thoughtful answers seemed to have gotten me a telephone interview. The telephone interview went really well but ultimately I was not extended the offer.  The direct supervisor who interviewed me was very nice to let me know and said it was a difficult decision.  I know she hesitated to call me in the first place because she said she thought I was overqualified for the position. I appreciated she gave me the opportunity anyway.  My guess is that this played into her final decision.  Overall, I got the impression it would have been a great organization and team to work for.
Interview Questions: I can't recall specific interview questions. It was more of a conversation.  We discussed the position and how my skills pertained to it.  We discussed what the school was hoping to do in the future and plans on how they would like to highlight the school and administration and how I might be able to help in that endeavor.  I recall that the interviewer liked my "energy" and ultimately I think being enthusiastic about the job played an important role in being considered for the position.

title: Admission Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Malibu, CA) in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: My interviewer was calm and nice. She described the job throughly and make myself very comfortable taking to her. The interview lasted 30 minutes with most questions are about my characteristic and how can I manage my time for work and study
Interview Questions: Why you want to work at International Program?

title: Marketing Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward and to the point. Great response. Very responsive interviewer. Loved the interaction. Very respectful of the interviewee’s preferences. Looking forward to working with this amazing institution. Also, the package and benefits are great too.
Interview Questions: Explain your past experiences in a similar job.

title: Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: Great! Very involved and down-to-earth interviewers. The whole process was clear and well organized. Several stages, starting with group interviews and ending with a panel. Remember to not worry about standing out too much in the group interview. They know what to look for, just be yourself.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself contributing to campus?

title: Student Accounts Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 part interview via zoom. The first interview was with GSEP team. They asked a few scenario questions, why I was interested in the position, and how I stay organized. They also asked if I ever worked with adult students, considering it’s for the graduate program. There was no religious questions asked in the first round of interviews. In the second interview was with the Dean. She started the interview by asking me to lead a prayer. Asked how I practiced and stayed active in my religion.
Interview Questions:
How do you stay organized?
What interested you about the position?
What do you know about pepperdine and why would you be a good fit?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: Spoke with the Professor I would act as research assistant for. We spoke for about 40 minutes regarding my relevant experience as well as my schedule. Was notified during the interview that I had the job.
Interview Questions: Q: How has your prior course experience prepared you for this position?

title: Human Resources Specialist (HR Specialist) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Malibu, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very religious based interview. And patriarchal. Never spoke to any female leaders. Didn't seem to have any women in leadership positions. Everyone was very nice. And young. And male. Job was also a bit too entry level for me.
Interview Questions: How my personal religious view aligned with Christianity.

title: Academic Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: Was fairly straight forward and I was pleased to stay updated throughout the process with the team. They asked general questions about roles and my background and how it would apply
Interview Questions: Why do you think you'd be suited for this role?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well. The interview went by quickly and receptive of my questions at the end. They were also very welcoming and made me feel comfortable during the process.
Interview Questions: How do you practice your faith and how can you bring that to this current position

title: Library Marketing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: I applied on Handshake and my supervisor emailed me asking to interview me. She was kind and professional and the interview was easy to get through. It felt more like a conversation.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in marketing?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Pepperdine University
Interview Descriptions: It was a little stressful. They asked me questions that were controversial to the rules at Pepperdine, but I answered responsibly. They had multiple rounds. The first one was a group interview and the second session was individual sessions. I hoped that I was able to make it to the next round.
Interview Questions: If someone came to you in confidence about an alcohol issue would you tell DPS?

title: International Programs Interview Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Malibu, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The first interview was very relaxed and informal.  I found about the position through a friend at Pepperdine, so they already knew me before the job.   I just met with my supervisor and he asked me about my availability and past job experiences.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in this office?  Also, what past experiences do you have that could contribute to your role here?

title: Healthy Minds Co-President Interview

Interview Questions: what is the kind of company culture that you're looking for?

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview

title: Event Coordinator Interview

title: Executive Assistant Interview

title: Administrative Assistant Interview

title: Intern - Hourly Interview

title: Integrated Marketing Communications Interview

title: Office Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Malibu, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
The process took 3 weeks. I applied online, and was contacted the next day to come in that week for an in-person interview. I met with 2 people (so balancing eye-contact was a new challenge for me). It took about 40 minutes. I received a call 3 days later, asking if I could come in for a second interview. I met with a team of 5 people, then the provost, then other staff members of the two offices that the manager would work in. This process took about an hour, and we talked for a while which was a good sign, I thought. She even asked to see a writing sample which I sent in later that day. 

However I received an email the following week saying they had filled the position.

title: Administrative Coordinator Interview

title: Financial Analyst Interview

title: Office Assistant Interview

title: Summer Intern Interview

title: Project Coordinator Interview

The in-person interview was as expected, no behavioral questions. It was more to know how well you will fit within the team dynamic.
Interview Questions: What would be your step of action if you are faced with multiple projects all due within a relative short period of time.

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Los Angeles, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via their website in November. Got a call for an interview in January. Had an initial interview with the Executive Director, then second round with the Dean, and third round with other staff. They were accommodating to my schedule and organized. I had already scheduled a family vacation in between what would have been the first and second interview. They were willing to wait until I came back which was really nice of them.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to work with a difficult client/student, what did you do and what were the results?

title: Interactive Content Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Pepperdine University (Malibu, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: As you might expect from such a religious school, everyone involved in the hiring process is very polite and mild-mannered. While the job was posted online, they were looking for someone who was sent their way via referrals (no surprise there, really). It is very important to show in both your cover letter and resume that you are OK with the religious mission of the university. Make sure that all your materials (resume, cover letter, work samples) are absolutely free of spelling and grammar mistakes. The interview process is three stage - first, an individual phone call with the head of interactive, then a conference call with everyone on the team, and finally, an in-person interview on the campus. The conference call is the most challenging part of the process, as there are a lot of people in the room, and each one has their own personal agenda. It can be difficult to figure out who is asking what, and why, but the best thing you can do is to try to be diplomatic if someone starts asking questions that seem more like barbs aimed at other people in the room (or past mistakes that you are not aware of).
Interview Questions: What would you do to help us fulfill the mission of the school by improving our website?

title: Career Services GA Interview

Once the Skype interview was complete, I received an email within the week saying I was hired.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
